comment: Took her for online Psyc 4100 and I was on edge the entire semester. She gives you 4-6 assignments every week but will not post grades until the end of the semester. Left everyone on edge about where they stood the entire semester. Its a point based class so make sure you turn in all assignments because they do add up!

I despised Dr. Williamson. Out of all my teachers in my life, i have never disliked someone as much as her. She cant teach. Half of the time the tests, would be thrown at us. No preparation at all. She wouldnt even be present for when we took the test. The test were nothing at all like the study guides. Do not recommend.

I dont know how I got an A in this class bc I consistently made Cs on her tests with one A which was the first test. I guess its because there are so many other assignments that balance it out. But I am shocked either way. She gives good examples and makes learning psych and little easier. Participation is a good part of the grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: slightly unfair
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Such a bad professor. I'm probably going to make a C in her class and I have a 4.0. Her exams come from left field and you feel as if you can't study enough because none of her material prepares you for her tests. The project has no outline for the semester and shes constantly behind so you have to re-do completed work. She can leave KSU.

Shes a good professor. I have an A but we still have one more test to take. You dont necessarily have to pay attention in class but you do need to come. Study before you exams and youll definitely be fine. She really does try to make the class entertaining. Gives plenty of extra credit. 4 tests that are easy if you actually study. Online hw.....

Extremely lecture heavy but if you pay attention and take sufficient enough notes hopefully you'll get the A. 4 Exams 50 MC and Final is optional. Dr. W is more than happy to help you outside of class if you don't understand a concept.
Not a hard teacher or grader. Her class was just boring lectures but work was easy and test straight from the PowerPoints. She also give lots of extra credit at the end of the semester.

The class is very very lecture heavy. Unfortunately, there wasnt always enough time in class (because of in class concept checks) to finish covering all the information, even though it was still on the test. A good grade requires a good memory and a LOT of out of class studying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Her lectures are only the slides she provides online, but she does give you easy 100 for class participation. It's worth 23% of grade, so show up. Just study her slides. She does small extra credits over the semester, but they do add up and can make a difference in your overall grade. Do SONA early in the semester, it's also an easy 100.

She doesn't take attendance but she offers class participation each day, and you will get a 0 if you are not there. She is a very sweet lady but teaches an awfully boring class. Lots of memorization for the test, and way too much info.

The class wasn't bad. It was all Powerpoint lectures and reading the book. She's very strict on attendance, and the class feels very long. It's easy to see how much she loves Psychology, but the class is dreary and no one wants to participate. The online assignments are quick and painless.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She gives long lectures that she tries to make interesting but bottom line they're still lectures... She also gives in class participation about once a week and you never know which day so even though attendance isn't required, still go. The tests are fairly easy if you study and pay attention, or you'll fail them and they're 50 multiple choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Reading is crucial in 1101 unless you memorize the powerpoints. She posts all of the PP's online, so attendance at the beginning of the semester really isn't necessary. At the end there are tons of participation grades, though. A lot of her test questions are right from the book! I have made 96-98s on all the tests, my friends who don't read fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is very nice. It is important to study as you go and not cram before the test. It makes it a lot easier when the tests roll around. She says it is important to read to textbook but I have just been thoroughly reviewing the power points and making A's on her tests.

Dr. Williamson is a good professor, but you can expect this class to be a hard one. You will need to be able to devote a lot of time to do well. If you need help and you ask for it, she will be willing to help you. Biggest downside to this class was there was a lot of busy work and grades were not always posted in a timely manner. DON'T SKIP CLASS.

Dr. Williamson is a good professor teaching a horribly boring and dry class. Show up to class and study at least an hour before each test and you can expect at least a high B. Seriously don't skip class. If you find yourself skipping a lot don't take this course.

Great teacher, explains things very well. I like her teaching style and was always willing to help and answer questions. Down side is she grades really hard, this class is probably the hardest one in the program and she knows it. Thought some of her grading was really unfair and most of the time unclear about what she wanted but will take late work

Awesome professor and great at teaching material, very helpful, has high test averages (so everyone usually does well).  Not very clear with homework all the time, but it's ok because she accepts late homework usually.  Also, don't take this class if you love trees because you will be printing a TON of things.... :-)

Dr. Williamson is a very good professor. She tells you in the beginning exactly what to expect from the course. All power points are fill in the blank so that you can follow along when shes teaching. All of the assignments  help with the understanding of the content so that by the time a test roles around you already know exactly what to expect.

Wonderful Professor!! One of the best in the psych department. Power points are to be printed before class and are fill in the blank. She takes time to explain and demonstrate the material. Experimental is a tough course, but Dr. Williamson breaks it down so that you truly understand it. She is very helpful and wants to see you succeed. Take her!!!

She was an awesome teacher! I definitely recommend her. Attendance is a must but she makes learning really easy and the material is very relatable as long as you show up. Ppts need to be printed before class is all. If you try, she's veryyyy helpful! Exp and Physio were great with her!

Great professor. You MUST attend class if you want to pass. The material is hard, but she breaks it down to where you understand it. If you study the material, do the study guides and come to class you will pass. Her UTA's were also very helpful.
She is very typical of the psychology department here at KSU. She is easy to pass, but you'll get little to no consideration from her in the future.

Experimental is a HARD course, but Dr. Williamson makes it so easy to understand. She is always available to answer questions. She actually breaks the material down until everyone is on the same page and understands. Her tests can be a little challenging, but she does create study guides and jeopardy questions which help! But DO NOT skip class.

Awesome! Lectures can be a little dry, but what can else could you expect in experimental? She does example experiments in class to demonstrate the material, which helps a lot! If you go to class and fill in the PowerPoints she posts, you'll do fine!

Very sweet, knowledgable professor. Experimental is not a particularly fun class, but she is SO willing to help and makes it as interesting as possible by allowing students to pick their own topics, work in groups, etc.  Go to the TA study sessions before each exam! Definitely recommend her.

Dr. Williamson is awesome. The course content is NOT easy, but she provides extremely clear review sheets and has TAs that held study groups before any kind of quiz or test. Lectures were very interesting. Attendance is not mandatory, but exams come almost entirely from lecture. Missing will hurt you. Take her, and work hard. She's great!

Dr. W is an amazing professor that I would recommend to anyone who wants to learn about the bio aspect of psyc. The material is tough but she presents it in a way that is interesting and easy to learn. Also, I had some health issues this semester and she went above and beyond to check on me and help me in any way she could. Not many profs do that

Dr. Williamson is a fantastic teacher (one of the best in the psych dept). She is tough but she gives you all the possible resources needed to do well. I would not suggest ever buying a book for her classes because her tests come straight from the powerpoints.  HIGHLY recommend for Physio or experimental.
Dr. Williamson is a great professor and is willing to help but physio is HARD and her tests are not all mutiple choice. This class is heavy on anatomy.

She's a great teacher, highly recommend her. Always willing to go above and beyond to help students understand the info. The class is not easy, but she makes it an enjoyable course. She's not an easy grader, however it is a 4000 level course, so that is expected. Her exams aren't easy, but if you use all the resources she gives, you'll do well.

One of my favorite profs in the psych department. She LOVES her field, is very nice/helpful, and makes a difficult subject interesting. We dissected sheep brains. Lots of opportunities for points. The paper is only 3-4 pages, but she can be a tough grader. Attend & read the book and you'll do great. I really recommend Dr. W.

She is a great teacher with a passion for the subject matter. You must attend classes to complete the PowerPoints. My only gripe is the long delay in getting graded material back. When trying to monitor grades at the end of the semester, it is difficult to know where you stand while waiting on grades, especially the writing assignment.
Take good notes-her powerpoints are incomplete-have to go to class to complete.Give detail to grammar on paper. She is nice and very helpful. I did enjoy the class!

She is a very nice teacher but, if your grammar is lacking do not take her.  She will deduct up to 50% of the grade for each assignment due to grammar. I went from a solid A to low B because of grammar.  Do not buy the book in any of her classes.  She is power point only.

I just graduated and have to say that she was my FAV. psychology professor of them all. She's so sweet, VERY helpful, and loves her job. Had her for Exp. and Physio. Show an effort and do the work, she will help you succeed, without question! Tests, writing assignments, Group presentations in both classes - very laid back though.
I love Dr. Williamson. I had her for Experimental and Physio. I made an "A" in both classes but not without effort. She's truly a nice lady :)

*LOTS OF BUSY WORK* Best way to study is to get the powerpoints & make your own study guide then she'll post a study guide before each test. Make sure your an organized person so you don't forget when to turn things in & complete all the HW, SPSS Labs, and Writing assignments...There's one HUGE paper due at the end of the course!

Dr. Williamson made a complex subject very easy to understand. Her lecture style was good and she "quizzed" us before and after lectures, which helped reinforce what we learned.  Very good class and not a difficult A if you study hard.

She is one of the best professors I have had at KSU as far as explaining hard material. She is very good at dumbing things down for everyone to understand. She does count attendance, but you wouldn't want to miss anyway, there are a lot of notes, and you'll do much better on tests if you go.
Took her Psychopharmacology class...her exams are hard, but she is very helpful. Once you take notes from her powerpoint presentations and study, you should do well.
